1) Welcome! It's great to have you here.

@Phil Ward Coming from Drupal, I was also missing the extra field templates of Display Suite but never really needed them in Backdrop so far. Speaking of alternatives, apart of https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/field_wrappers you could place single fields as blocks in a layout for your content type (layout has to have a 'node context') and configure the block markup for the block dynamically, or write custom field templates for your theme.

backdrop-contrib/field_wrappers
Using the Field Wrappers module, site administrators will be able to choose HTML wrappers for fields. - backdrop-contrib/field_wrappers

There are also some interesting discussions in (not so recent) Backdrop core issues regarding field output:

  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2084
  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2608
[META] [UX] Add more Display Suite features · Issue #2084 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Changes we'd like to see in Backdrop Core: Add blocks for individual fields ability to create custom display modes #1691 - create reusable set of blocks #2894 replace the Manage display page wi...
UX Idea: Allow rewriting the output of fields on display (without having to use views or custom code). · Issue #2608 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
We already allow hiding fields from display and also hiding their label (we also have these options available for fields in views), but what options does one have if they need to rewrite the output...

Hi @Phil Ward welcome to Backdrop CMS:-) I made also heavy use of DS in Drupal 7, especially the extended features. I also loved the possibility to add anything into the wrapper (not only CSS classes, but also DOM elements from my CSS framework). To be honest, there's no 100% replacement for those functions in Backdrop CMS at this time. So I had to learn basic templating to get advanced(!) functions included, e.g. a bottom slider with partner logos. I am not a developer, but I would never go back to Display Suite, after learning how fast I can achieve things in code compared to the UI of Display Suite, especially when I need similar functions for a different content type.. But let me be clear... I am talking about advanced theming requirements, beyond adding just CSS classes to a field wrapper. (BTW, my preferred Display Suite functions in D7 did not even make it to DS version 8. DS in D8 was a quite frustrating experience). But with Field Wrapper module and some knowledge how to print variables in TPL files, you can do a lot in Backdrop CMS

For example I would like to have the breadcrumb exactly under the header (exactly under it in contact with the black background of the header). In the layout builder if I place it last in the header it gets inside the black background of the header which is not wanted. If I place is first in the "TOP" it goes under the page title. Hi, cptX. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Fine then I'll stick here.

In which file should I add my css customizations without affecting core theme? I'm almost achieving what I wanted regarding bringing the breadcrumb above. The only think I'm missing now is to where I should put a couple of css modifications

To try and answer your questions here, there are probably multiple ways to accomplish what you want. I personally would add blocks to the layout in a way that makes sense (i.e. if a block should be part of the Header, don't add it to a different region just because it's styled better there). Once all blocks are in the appropriate regions of the Layout, use CSS to theme them appropriately.
What theme are you using?

I'm using the default theme. Indeed by modifying the position of the breadcrumb and especially by adding a "Page local actions" block under the page title (as I wanted) now the breadcrumb is almost next to the header and with a small css modification I can move it even closer to the header

Most contrib themes should have a file where you can add custom CSS without causing issues during updates. If using a core theme, the best way would be to create a sub-theme and add your custom CSS theme. There are easier ways, but maybe not as 'recommended'.

If using Basis (the default theme), maybe the easiest, and best, way would be to install Thesis instead: https://backdropcms.org/project/thesis It's a sub-theme of Basis that let's you easily add your own CSS.
Perfect, let's try it! Thanks!
2 lines of css added in thesis theme and done!!! Thanks BWPanda!

Regarding the breadcrumbs: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4113

[UX] Better defaults position for breadcrumbs on installation of new sites. · Issue #4113 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Revised Description - UPDATED: Aug 14,2020 by @stpaultim The original issue suggested changing the order of title, breadcrumbs, and tabs. The only portion of this that I've noticed real support...
Ah, nice to know that I was not the only to find the default breadcrumb arrangement strange. I posted in the above issue my implementation as a reference.

I found in the layout--boxton--front.tpl.php this part 

  <div class="l-page-title">
    <a id="main-content"></a>
    <?php print render($title_prefix); ?>
    <?php if ($title): ?>
      <h1 class="page-title"><?php print $title; ?></h1>
    <?php endif; ?>
    <?php print render($title_suffix); ?>
  </div>

and I don't understand why the check for the title doesn't happen before the first div. In my implementation I present the page title in a block and thus the title divs remain in the output but without content. Should this be changed???

Thanks @cptX ...changing the markup of the current layout templates would break existing sites, and since in Backdrop we take care of backwards compatibility and try not to break people's sites, this will be hard to be changed in the 1.x version. In https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4929 some very interesting ideas were thrown on how to best handle such changes in general:

  • create new layout templates, and deprecate (but still support) the existing ones.
  • add new regions to existing layout templates.
  • see if we can fix these sorts of issues with some CSS (for which we have a bigger issue: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4782)
[UX] Switching the layout template for the home page layout to anything other than Boxton makes the hero block lose its full width. · Issue #4929 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Steps To Reproduce To reproduce the behavior: Vanilla backdrop installation Edit the default home page layout, and switch the template it uses from Boxton to any other core-provided template - >...
Add support for supplemental CSS selectors · Issue #4782 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
What about using special body classes to include new CSS? If new sites got the classes, but existing sites did not, we could prevent the CSS from affecting existing sites. (backwards-compatible) At...

This change probably doesn't break any compatibility because:

  • If title exists the output is the same
  • If title doesn't exist nothing will print which probably is the same as it is now as the divs now have no content inside.

So actually my question is did this happen on puprose or is a mistake?

So the only thing I suggest is to do this

<?php if ($title): ?>
<div class="l-page-title">
<a id="main-content"></a>
<?php print render($title_prefix); ?>
<h1 class="page-title"><?php print $title; ?></h1>
<?php print render($title_suffix); ?>
</div>
<?php endif; ?>

Maybe the title region should always be there for structural reasons, I don't know
@cptX even if no title is to be printed, we still need to print that <a id="main-content"></a> there. That's why.
...that ID helps scroll directly to the main content of pages, by providing links to people like for example: https://my.awesome.site/my-awesome-page#main-content
...so the if seems to be correctly placed around the h1 instead of the div in this case.
@cptX you need to copy the file named layout--boxton--front.tpl.phpto your theme/subtheme and do with it what you need. Don't forget flush cache after that.
OK guys thank you for the input.

...even if no title is to be printed, we still need to print that <a id="main-content"></a> there. That's why.

I'm not so sure I agree that that ID is correctly placed. It could easily be moved above the div and the if block then placed around the div without removing the ID, and I think the results would be the same.

We slept out two nights in a row (the first 2 days when the big quakes happened), but we aren't doing that any more unless the government instructs us to ...we have established "take cover" and escape route routines instead. My mom lives on the 3rd floor in our building, and mom-in-law on the 2nd with us, but every night now they both sleep on the ground-floor apartment with my uncle (all 3 of them are 80 y.o. and very slow, or simply cannot use the stairs due to old age issues). Being on the ground floor allows them to run (or "walk fast" I should say) outside the building in less time.
...over the last 24hrs we had a couple of 4+ quakes with their epicenter less than 10km from where we live, so they shook us pretty well. What usually happened before was me calling it out, and my wife and daughter would run to take cover under the living room table, which is strong. This morning my wife was browsing her phone for frittata recipes when it happened, and when I called "earthquake" she said "meh" :sweat_smile: ...didn't even move from her place :rolling_eyes:
I hope, your wife didn't "meh" with one of those 4+ quakes - otherwise I'd consider her pretty hard-boiled. :smirk: No, seriously, glad that you're alright. The whole area seems to keep on shaking...
